title: As a parent, I want to register and log in securely so that I can access my family's organized schedule.
description: Users need a way to create an account and log in to the Family Harmony Hub. This includes options for traditional email/password signup and integration with Google Sign-In for convenience.
acceptance_criteria: User can register with email and password.
User can log in with email and password.
User can register using Google Sign-In.
User can log in using Google Sign-In.
Secure password storage is implemented.
Error messages are displayed for invalid credentials.

title: As a parent, I want to create and manage profiles for myself and my children so that I can assign tasks and events accurately.
description: The application needs to support different user roles (parent, child) and allow parents to set up profiles for each child, including their name and age, to facilitate personalized scheduling and task assignment.
acceptance_criteria: Parent user can create their own profile.
Parent user can add multiple child profiles (Name, Age).
Each child profile has a unique identifier.
Parent user can edit child profile information.
Parent user can delete child profiles.
Role-based access is enforced (parents manage, children view/interact).

title: As a parent, I want to add and manage recurring events in the family calendar so that I don't have to manually enter weekly or monthly activities.
description: Parents need the ability to schedule activities like music lessons or sports practices that occur regularly (daily, weekly, monthly) without re-entering the details each time.
acceptance_criteria: User can add a new calendar event with title, date, time, duration, location, and notes.
User can assign an event to specific child profiles or the whole family.
User can set events to repeat daily.
User can set events to repeat weekly on selected days.
User can set events to repeat monthly on a specific date or day of the week.
User can edit existing recurring events, applying changes to future occurrences.
User can delete existing recurring events, with options to delete only this instance or all future instances.

title: As a parent, I want to sync my Family Harmony Hub calendar with my Google Calendar so that I have a single source of truth for all family events.
description: The application should integrate with Google Calendar to push scheduled events from Family Harmony Hub, ensuring parents don't miss important family activities when checking their primary calendar.
acceptance_criteria: User can securely connect their Google Calendar account via OAuth.
Events created in Family Harmony Hub are visible in the user's Google Calendar.
Changes made to events in Family Harmony Hub are reflected in Google Calendar.
The connection can be revoked by the user.
Error handling is in place for sync failures.

title: As a child, I want to see my assigned tasks and mark them as complete so that I can track my responsibilities and earn rewards.
description: Children need a clear and simple interface to view the tasks assigned to them (homework, chores, playtime) and easily indicate when they have finished them.
acceptance_criteria: Child user can view a list of tasks assigned to them.
Each task displays its title, description (optional), and deadline (if applicable).
Child user can tap/click a button to mark a task as 'completed'.
Visual feedback is provided upon task completion.
Completed tasks are clearly differentiated from pending tasks.
Parents receive a notification when a child marks a task as complete.

title: As a parent, I want to create and assign customizable rewards to my children so that I can motivate them to complete tasks.
description: Parents should be able to define various rewards (e.g., extra playtime, a small toy, a trip) and assign point values or link them to task completion, making the reward system flexible and engaging.
acceptance_criteria: Parent user can create a reward with a name and description.
Parent user can assign a point value required to redeem the reward.
Parent user can associate a reward with the completion of specific tasks or a set number of tasks.
Parent user can view a list of all created rewards.
Parent user can edit or delete existing rewards.
Children can see the list of available rewards and their point requirements.

title: As a child, I want to redeem points for rewards so that I can receive recognition for my completed tasks.
description: Children should be able to use their earned points to request rewards, providing a tangible outcome for their efforts.
acceptance_criteria: Child user can view their current point balance.
Child user can view available rewards they have enough points for.
Child user can select a reward and initiate a redemption request.
The system deducts points (pending approval) upon redemption request.
Parent user receives a notification about the reward redemption request.

title: As a parent, I want to approve or deny reward redemption requests so that I can maintain control over the reward system.
description: Parents need the ability to review requests from their children to redeem rewards and grant or deny them based on the child's behavior or task completion.
acceptance_criteria: Parent user can view pending reward redemption requests.
Parent user can approve a redemption request.
Upon approval, the reward is marked as granted to the child.
Parent user can deny a redemption request.
Child user is notified when their reward request is approved or denied.
If denied, points are returned to the child's balance.

title: As a parent, I want to add and manage shared family notes so that all family members can stay informed.
description: A central space for parents to post important announcements or reminders for the entire family, ensuring everyone is on the same page.
acceptance_criteria: Parent user can create a new note with a title and content.
Parent user can edit existing notes.
Parent user can delete notes.
All family members can view the list of notes.
Notifications are sent to linked parents/family members when a new note is added.

title: As a parent, I want to connect multiple parent accounts to a single family so that co-parents can collaborate effectively.
description: Allowing divorced or separated parents, or multiple caregivers, to share access and management of the family's schedule and tasks.
acceptance_criteria: A primary parent can invite another parent/guardian to join the family account.
Invited parent can accept the invitation and create/link their account.
All linked parents have shared visibility of the calendar, tasks, and notes.
All linked parents can create/edit events and assign/approve tasks and rewards.
The system clearly indicates which parent performed an action (optional).

title: As a user, I want to receive timely notifications for important events and tasks so that I don't miss anything.
description: Implement push notifications for upcoming events, task deadlines, reward approvals, and new family notes to keep users informed.
acceptance_criteria: User receives push notifications for upcoming calendar events (configurable time before).
User receives push notifications for task deadlines.
User receives push notifications when a task they assigned is marked complete.
User receives push notifications for reward redemption requests.
User receives push notifications for new family notes.
User can customize their notification preferences.

title: As a parent, I want to create a 21-day routine builder plan for my child so that I can help them establish new habits.
description: A dedicated feature to help parents guide their children through a structured 21-day program for building specific habits, with daily prompts and potential bonuses.
acceptance_criteria: Parent user can create a 21-day plan with a specific goal (e.g., 'Morning Routine').
Parent user can define daily tasks or check-ins required for the plan.
Child user sees the daily progress of their 21-day plan.
Child user can mark daily steps as complete.
The system visually tracks progress through the 21 days.
Option to offer bonus rewards upon successful completion of the 21-day plan.

title: As a user, I want an intuitive and visually appealing UI for both parents and children so that the app is easy and enjoyable to use.
description: The application's design should be user-friendly, with distinct interfaces tailored for parents (management-focused) and children (gamified and simple).
acceptance_criteria: App navigation is clear and consistent across platforms.
Parent interface prioritizes clarity and efficient management.
Child interface uses engaging visuals, simple language, and large tap targets.
Color schemes and iconography are appealing to both target audiences.
Key actions (e.g., adding events, completing tasks) are easily discoverable.

title: As a parent, I want to view reports on my child's task completion and reward history so that I can understand their progress and engagement.
description: Provide parents with insights into how often their children are completing tasks and redeeming rewards, helping them to guide and encourage their children.
acceptance_criteria: Parent user can access a reporting section.
Reports show task completion rates over selected periods (week, month).
Reports show a history of rewards earned and redeemed.
Reports can be filtered by child.
Data visualization (charts, graphs) is used to present information clearly.

title: As a parent, I want to set overall family goals that children can contribute to so that we can work towards collective achievements.
description: Introduce a feature for setting larger family goals (e.g., 'Save for a family vacation') that children contribute points towards, fostering a sense of teamwork.
acceptance_criteria: Parent user can create a family goal with a target point value.
Family members' points earned contribute to the goal.
Progress towards the family goal is visually displayed.
A reward or recognition is triggered upon reaching the goal.
